remarks: Define the set of atoms in a Hilbert lattice.  An atom is a nonzero element of a lattice such that anything less than it is zero, i.e. it is the smallest nonzero element of the lattice.  Definition of atom in [Kalmbach] p. 15.  See ~ ela and ~ elat2 for membership relations. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2002.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement: df-at $p |- HAtoms = { x e. CH | 0H <oH x } $.
